name: Drdongli.GitHub.com
body:
# Dong LI received a BEng degree in Computer Science in 2006, a MEng degree in Computer Science in 2009, both from Tianjin University, Tianjin, and a PhD degree in 2014 from The Hong Kong Polytechnic University, Hong Kong SAR, China. Currently, he is an Assistant Professor in Guangdong University of Technology. His research interests include topics in the fields of computer vision, pattern recognition, and image processing, such as feature matching, face recognition, and color correction.


## List of Publications:
## 1.	Dong Li and Kin-Man Lam, Design and Learn Distinctive Features from Pore-scale Facial Keypoints, Pattern Recognition, 48(3), pp. 732-745, 2015, doi: 10.1016/j.patcog.2014.09.026. (SCI)
## 2.	Dong Li, Huiling Zhou and Kin-Man Lam, High-Resolution Face Verification Using Pore-scale Facial Features, IEEE Transactions on Image Processing, 24(8), pp. 2317-2327, 2015, doi: 10.1109/TIP.2015.2412374. (SCI)
## 3.	Dong Li, Xudong Xie and Kin-Man Lam, Color Correction with Blind Image Restoration based on Multiple Images Using a Low-Rank Model, Journal of Electronic Imaging, 23(2), pp.023010-023010, 2014. doi:10.1117/1.JEI.23.2. 023010. (SCI)
## 4.	Dong Li, Xudong Xie and Kin-Man. Lam, Color Correction via Robust Reference selection and Recovery using a Low-Rank Matrix Model, In: Proc. 2011 IEEE International Conference on Image Processing (ICIP), pp. 2129-32, September 2011, Brussels, Belgium.
## 5.	Dong Li, Xudong Xie, Kin-Man Lam, and Zhigang Jin, Elastic block set reconstruction for face recognition, In: Proc. 2009 IEEE International Conference on Image Processing(ICIP), pp. 3329-3332, November 2009, Cairo, Egypt.
## 6.	Yue Deng, Dong Li, Kin-Man Lam, and Qionghai Dai, Partially occluded face completion and recognition, In: Proc. 2009 IEEE International Conference on Image Processing(ICIP), pp. 4145-4148, November 2009, Cairo, Egypt.
## 7.	Dong Li, Xudong Xie, Qionghai Dai, Zhigang Jin, Gabor Boost Linear Discriminant Analysis, In: Proc. 2009 IEEE International Conference on Multimedia and Expo(ICME), pp. 1050-1053, June 2009, New York, USA.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
